results.title: Green light for the traffic of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Igor Scherb and Federal Republic of Germany
results.brief_description: Traffic problems in transport in Germany. Planning for modern transport arteria: phased traffic lights; traffic counter cylinder placed under the road surface to measure traffic density and automatically adjusts traffic light to govern traffic flow. Frankfurt has radar system to regulate traffic lights - the first in Germany. Use of television to watch flow and allows police to intervene in heavily congested areas - mobile radar checks to control traffic - construction of autobahn widening of existing roads.

results.title: Green horizons
results.brief_description: Show land in New Zealand damaged by over grazing and bushfires. Reports on the measures taken to reclaim land including extermination of rabbits, contour ploughing and education of farmers in conservation methods.

results.title: Green grows the Mallee
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the Pomona Experimental Farm at Murrayville in Victoria, in the use of underground water. Bores were sunk and yielded ample water but problems had still to be overcome in the preparation of the irrigation area. The manufacturing processes of the Pomona Deep Well Turbine pump illustrate the care and engineering precision in the production assembly and testing of the pump units. Irrigation scheme using bore water provide Mallee farmers with security against the threat of drought.

results.title: Green Gold
results.brief_description: The setting of this film is a small community of farmers who make their living not only from the land but also from the forest. We see many of the complicated links in the chain that brings the products of this forest to the consumer, including transport, milling and processing., The various uses of timber are described. But forests cannot be mined, as can metal deposits. Tress are a crop like any other and must be carefully planted, tended and protected against pests, fires and indiscriminate cutting. At a timber conference, experts of the Food and Agriculture Organization seek a lasting solution to the problem of timber shortage. Unexplored areas of forest resources must be tapped; cultivated forests must be conserved. New machines and techniques will also help in processing and developing the products, Co-operation is the only real chance for world-wide progress in conservation.

results.title: Green and gold greats
results.brief_description: This program brings together a fifty year span of Australian sporting splendour including performances of Don Bradman, Dawn Fraser, Heather McKay, Walter Lindrum, Majorie Jackson, Betty Cuthbert, Herb Helliot, Peter Thomson, Les Darcy, Vic Patrick, Merwyn Wood, Lew Hoad, Ken Rosewall and Phar Lap.

results.title: Green
results.brief_description: Surfing set to music - documentary footage of professional male surfers from four locations across the world and featuring some 50 surfers. Heaps of slow-motion short-board action and a few wipeouts just to keep things interesting. Shot in Mexico, Australia, California, and Hawaii by producer/director Matt Wybenga. Some of the surfers featured include: Joel Parkinson, Mick Fanning, Andy Irons, Kelly Slater and Taj Burrow. Music includes artists DJ Shadow, Ziggy Marley, Single Handed and Coal Chamber.

results.title: Great walls make great art
results.brief_description: Great art is one of the world’s most expensive commodities - well out of the reach of most people. This film considers the multimillion dollar art industry which makes available inexpensive paintings according to public tastes and changing fashions in interior design.

results.title: Great Plan problems
results.brief_description: Shows the Backby community school complex at Vasteras, Sweden, which is famous throughout Sweden as a particularly well-planned design. It also shows how the early hopes for the school have not been attained because of certain failures of communication between the school and the community it serves. An analysis of the failure is a feature of the film

results.title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
results.creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services
results.brief_description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Grant Wood 1892-1942 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents the story of Grant Wood, an American self-taught artist who painted the gentle curves of his neighbouring hills, the neatly ploughed fields, the daily routine of western life as well as such classic themes in American History as Paul Revere’s ride. The film brings together a collection of Grant Wood’s best work. Credits include: photography by John Lewis; music by Lan Adomian. Narrated by Henry Fonda.
